definition: usual trick/old tactics
happening/instance/reason/cause/intentional/former/old/friend/therefore/hence/(of people) to die, dead
artistry/talent/skill/(in ancient times) female entertainer
to repeat an old stratagem/up to one's old tricks

sentences.english: The company is now trying to pull off a similar trick with tea in the Middle East.
sentences.chinese: 現在，該公司又想在中東的茶葉市場上故伎重演。

sentences.english: Months later, he did it again.
sentences.chinese: 幾個月之後，他故伎重施。

sentences.english: This means that the US is about to repeat its "Kyoto experience".
sentences.chinese: 這就意味着美國將重演其“京都故伎”。

definition: to repeat an old stratagem/up to one's old tricks
to seize an opportunity/to exploit (a loophole)
unprepared/off guard
lit. to follow the recipe (idiom)/fig. to follow a set pattern
to look for an opportunity
to wait for an opportunity/to watch for one's chance
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
who would have thought that/who would have expected that
to threaten the east and strike to the west (idiom)/to create a diversion
to escape without trace (idiom); to make one's getaway (from the scene of a crime)/to show a clean pair of heels
to take advantage of sb in an unguarded moment (idiom)/to take sb by surprise
to take advantage of a favorable situation/to seize an opportunity
to prevail/to have one's way/to get away with it
lit. to pull a snake from its hole/to expose a malefactor (idiom)
evil plan/evil schemes
to follow up a victory and press home the attack/to pursue retreating enemy
